name: COBRA 13.5OZ INDIGO
description:
COBRA - SUPER SLIM FIT 13.5OZ INDIGO MODEL This 13.5oz redline line selvage denim has a crisp and rigid hand making it ideal to break in from raw and create your own faded jeans that are personal to you. It's always best to start from raw, to fade and wear your jeans into your body shape for a natural, laid back looking pair of jeans. The tightly woven short slub weave selvage denim will produce jeans with an interesting and uneven character as they age. All the best characters are uneven. Wash them frequently or only every six months, it's up to you, they will all look good with age and wear. Take a look at the jeans details page for more information about this amazing Japanese selvage denim. Traditional hand felled seams are used to construct the rise and seat. Hand felled seams are a strong and clean construction method which is rarely seen on garments today, hand felled seams date back to the early workwear garments of the late 1800's. All garments are designed, pattern drafted and handmade using old world sewing techniques by Ande Whall in New Zealand. The Ande Whall ethos is to design the best denim garments possible, not to copy the past masters, but to create new classics.
  • Raw selvage denim
  • Denim from Okayama Japan
  • 13.5oz sanforized
  • Super dark indigo
  • Red selvage line
  • Short slub weave
  • Cotton from Zimbabwe
  • X-bar tacked back pockets
  • Wings back pocket stitching
  • Leather waistband patch
  • 9 waist Sizes
  • 5 inseam lengths
  • Handmade by Ande Whall
  • Made in New Zealand
  • All prices are in $USD
www.facebook.com/andewhalldenimco **NEW! FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING** **********TO 43 COUNTRIES!********** Please read the terms and shipping page for more information. Please read the sizing and shrinkage information on the size chart page before ordering to find your correct size.

name: GRIZZLY - 13OZ ORIGINAL
description:
TEMPORARILY OUT OF DENIM STOCK GRIZZLY - 13OZ ORIGINAL SLIM FIT JACKET AVAILABLE IN REGULAR & LONG ARM The Grizzly jacket is cut very slim. It works well as a top layer in summer with a t-shirt or shirt underneath and a great mid layer in winter under an overcoat. The indigo is a slightly lighter shade than the dark indigo jeans and has a soft hand which makes it extremely comfortable to wear. The front pockets provide hand warmth for outdoor loitering and you will find yourself using them all the time. The shirt style two piece collar gives a slicker look than the standard work wear style. The Grizzly jacket is completely single needle made with red selvage ID line detail on the front placket, inside jet pockets, waistband and cuffs. The front breast pockets are lined with 6.5oz selvage shirt weight denim and riveted for extra strength. Traditional hand felled seams are used throughout the jacket, which is a strong and clean construction method which is rarely seen on garments today. Hand felled seams date back to the early workwear garments of the late 1800's. All garments are designed, pattern drafted and handmade using old world sewing techniques by Ande Whall in New Zealand. The Ande Whall ethos is to design the best denim garments possible, not to copy the past masters, but to create new classics.
  • 13oz Indigo selvage denim
  • Denim from Okayama Japan
  • One wash - will not shrink
  • Red selvage ID line
  • Slim cut - longer body
  • Soft and comfortable wearing
  • Lighter shade of indigo
  • Traditional hand felled seams
  • Selvage front facing
  • Selvage cuffs and waistband
  • Shirt Style two piece collar
  • Lined front breast pockets
  • Front hand warmer pockets
  • Handmade by Ande Whall
  • Made in New Zealand

name: WOLF - 13OZ ORIGINAL
description:
WOLF - 13OZ ORIGINAL REGULAR - SLIM FIT JACKET AVAILABLE IN REGULAR & LONG ARM The Wolf jacket is made from a beautiful 13oz natural indigo dyed denim. The denim is a dark shade of indigo with a crisp rigid hand. The pleated front with two breast pockets and a rounded collar give it a vintage look. The back pleats have been sewn down half way to keep the body slim while the open pleats at the top provide room to move across the shoulders. The Wolf jacket is completely single needle made with blue selvage ID line detail on the front placket, waistband and cuffs. The front breast pockets are lined with 6.5oz selvage shirt weight denim and riveted for extra strength. Traditional hand felled seams are used throughout the jacket, which is a strong and clean construction method which is rarely seen on garments today. Hand felled seams date back to the early workwear garments of the late 1800's. All garments are designed, pattern drafted and handmade using old world sewing techniques by Ande Whall in New Zealand. The Ande Whall ethos is to design the best denim garments possible, not to copy the past masters, but to create new classics.

  • Dark indigo selvage denim
  • Denim from Okayama Japan

name: WOLF - CORDUROY
description:
WOLF - CORDUROY DETAIL REGULAR - SLIM FIT JACKET AVAILABLE IN REGULAR & LONG ARM The Wolf jacket is made from a beautiful 13oz natural indigo dyed denim. The denim is a dark shade of indigo with a crisp rigid hand. The pleated front with two breast pockets and a flared tip collar give it a vintage look. The back pleats have been sewn down and riveted half way to keep the body slim while the open pleats at the top provide room to move across the shoulders. The yoke and cuff linings are cut from a nice walnut coloured six wale corduroy. The yoke and pockets are lined with 100% cotton star printed fabric. The Wolf jacket is completely single needle made with blue selvage ID line detail on the front placket and waistband. The front breast pockets are riveted for extra strength. Traditional hand felled seams are used throughout the jacket, which is a strong and clean construction method which is rarely seen on garments today. Hand felled seams date back to the early workwear garments of the late 1800's. All garments are designed, pattern drafted and handmade using old world sewing techniques by Ande Whall in New Zealand. The Ande Whall ethos is to design the best denim garments possible, not to copy the past masters, but to create new classics.
